cards.name: Accursed Spirit
cards.text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
cards.flavor: Many have heard the slither of dragging armor and the soft squelch of its voice. But only its victims ever meet its icy gaze.

cards.name: Act on Impulse
cards.text: Exile the top three cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may play cards exiled this way. (If you cast a spell this way, you still pay its costs. You can play a land this way only if you have an available land play remaining.)
cards.flavor: "You don't want to know what happens after I put on the goggles."

cards.name: Aegis Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Aegis Angel enters the battlefield, another target permanent gains indestructible for as long as you control Aegis Angel. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.name: Aeronaut Tinkerer
cards.text: Aeronaut Tinkerer has flying as long as you control an artifact. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: "All tinkerers have their heads in the clouds. I don't intend to stop there."

cards.name: Ætherspouts
cards.text: For each attacking creature, its owner puts it on the top or bottom of his or her library.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry, there's plenty for everyone."
—Vickon, Eleventh Company battlemage

cards.name: Aggressive Mining
cards.text:
You can't play lands.
Sacrifice a land: Draw two cards. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: Designed by Markus Persson

cards.name: Ajani Steadfast
cards.text:
+1: Until end of turn, up to one target creature gets +1/+1 and gains first strike, vigilance, and lifelink.
−2: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control and a loyalty counter on each other planeswalker you control.
−7: You get an emblem with "If a source would deal damage to you or a planeswalker you control, prevent all but 1 of that damage."

cards.name: Ajani's Pridemate
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Ajani's Pridemate.
cards.flavor:
"When one of us prospers, the pride prospers."
—Jazal Goldmane

cards.name: Altac Bloodseeker
cards.text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, Altac Bloodseeker gets +2/+0 and gains first strike and haste until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, and it can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Amphin Pathmage
cards.text: {2}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor:
"There are those who do not believe in the existence of the amphin. This seems somehow to be of their own design."
—Gor Muldrak, Cryptohistories

cards.name: Ancient Silverback
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Avacyn, Guardian Angel
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
{1}{W}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to another target creature this turn by sources of the color of your choice.
{5}{W}{W}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target player this turn by sources of the color of your choice.

cards.name: Avarice Amulet
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0 and has vigilance and "At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card."
When equipped creature dies, target opponent gains control of Avarice Amulet.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: Designed by Penny Arcade

cards.name: Back to Nature
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.flavor: There will always be those who presume to improve nature, or dare to befoul it. And nature will always have a response.

cards.name: Battle Mastery
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor:
"Boom! Boom! Boots the size of oxcarts, then an axe like a falling sun. Elves scattered. Trees scattered. Even the hills ran for the hills!"
—Clachan Tales

cards.name: Battlefield Forge
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool. Battlefield Forge deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Belligerent Sliver
cards.text: Sliver creatures you control have "This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures."
cards.flavor:
"The slivers became adept at provoking a fear response in other species."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

cards.name: Black Cat
cards.text: When Black Cat dies, target opponent discards a card at random.
cards.flavor: Its last life is spent tormenting your dreams.

cards.name: Blastfire Bolt
cards.text: Blastfire Bolt deals 5 damage to target creature. Destroy all Equipment attached to that creature.
cards.flavor:
"Encase yourself in the most elaborate armor, and cower behind the heaviest shield. I would hate for you to feel helpless."
—Korig the Ruiner

cards.name: Blood Host
cards.text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice another creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Blood Host and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: It would be ill-mannered to decline his invitation. It would be ill-advised to accept it.

cards.name: Boonweaver Giant
cards.text: When Boonweaver Giant enters the battlefield, you may search your graveyard, hand, and/or library for an Aura card and put it onto the battlefield attached to Boonweaver Giant. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.

cards.name: Borderland Marauder
cards.text: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Though she is rightly feared, there are relatively few tales of her deeds in battle, for few survive her raids.

cards.name: Brawler's Plate
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and has trample. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Equip {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Bronze Sable
cards.flavor:
The Champion stood alone between the horde of the Returned and the shrine to Karametra, cutting down scores among hundreds. She would have been overcome if not for the aid of the temple guardians whom Karametra awakened.
—The Theriad

cards.name: Brood Keeper
cards.text: Whenever an Aura becomes attached to Brood Keeper, put a 2/2 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield. It has "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: "Come, little one. Unfurl your wings, fill your lungs, and release your first fiery breath."

cards.name: Burning Anger
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player."
cards.flavor: "With rage as your forge, your hammer can smite anything."

cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: "What you are attempting is not against the law. It is, however, extremely foolish."

cards.name: Carnivorous Moss-Beast
cards.text: {5}{G}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Carnivorous Moss-Beast.
cards.flavor: Ranger wisdom dictates that when fleeing from a moss-beast, you must stay calm, find your bearings, and run south.

cards.name: Carrion Crow
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Carrion Crow enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: When carrion feeds on carrion, dark days approach.

cards.name: Caustic Tar
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target player loses 3 life."
cards.flavor: A forest fire can rejuvenate the land, but the tar's vile consumption leaves the land forever ruined.

cards.name: Caves of Koilos
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Caves of Koilos deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Centaur Courser
cards.flavor:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

cards.name: Chandra, Pyromaster
cards.text:
+1: Chandra, Pyromaster deals 1 damage to target player and 1 damage to up to one target creature that player controls. That creature can't block this turn.
0: Exile the top card of your library. You may play it this turn.
−7: Exile the top ten cards of your library. Choose an instant or sorcery card exiled this way and copy it three times. You may cast the copies without paying their mana costs.

cards.name: Charging Rhino
cards.text: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: The knights of Troinir Keep took the rhino as their emblem due to its intense focus when charging down a perceived threat—a trait they discovered on a hunting excursion.

cards.name: Chasm Skulker
cards.text:
Whenever you draw a card, put a +1/+1 counter on Chasm Skulker.
When Chasm Skulker dies, put X 1/1 blue Squid creature tokens with islandwalk onto the battlefield, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters on Chasm Skulker. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: Designed by Mike Neumann

cards.name: Chief Engineer
cards.text: Artifact spells you cast have convoke. (Your creatures can help cast those spells. Each creature you tap while casting an artifact spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
cards.flavor: An eye for detail, a mind for numbers, a soul of clockwork.

cards.name: Child of Night
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: Sins that would be too gruesome in the light of day are made more pleasing in the dark of night.

cards.name: Chord of Calling
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Chronostutter
cards.text: Put target creature into its owner's library second from the top.
cards.flavor: Timing is everything.

cards.name: Circle of Flame
cards.text: Whenever a creature without flying attacks you or a planeswalker you control, Circle of Flame deals 1 damage to that creature.
cards.flavor:
"Which do you think is a better deterrent: a moat of water or one of fire?"
—Chandra Nalaar

cards.name: Clear a Path
cards.text: Destroy target creature with defender.
cards.flavor:
"Why do guards always look surprised when we bash them?" asked Ruric.
"I think they expect a bribe," said Thar.

cards.name: Cone of Flame
cards.text: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.

cards.name: Congregate
cards.text: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—Song of All, canto 642

cards.name: Constricting Sliver
cards.text: Sliver creatures you control have "When this creature enters the battlefield, you may exile target creature an opponent controls until this creature leaves the battlefield."
cards.flavor: Slivers are often seen toying with enemies they capture, not out of cruelty, but to fully learn their physical capabilities.

cards.name: Coral Barrier
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Coral Barrier enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 blue Squid creature token with islandwalk onto the battlefield. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.name: Covenant of Blood
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Covenant of Blood deals 4 damage to target creature or player and you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Crippling Blight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and can't block.
cards.flavor:
"Still alive? No matter. I'll leave you as a warning to others who would oppose me."
—Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter

cards.name: Crowd's Favor
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Crucible of Fire
cards.text: Dragon creatures you control get +3/+3.
cards.flavor:
"The dragon is a perfect marriage of power and the will to use it."
—Sarkhan Vol

cards.name: Cruel Sadist
cards.text:
{B}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on Cruel Sadist.
{2}{B}, {T}, Remove X +1/+1 counters from Cruel Sadist: Cruel Sadist deals X damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
Face of innocence. Hand of death.
Designed by Edmund McMillen

cards.name: Darksteel Citadel
cards.text:
Indestructible (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy this land.)
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Structures built from darksteel yield to neither assault nor age.

cards.name: Dauntless River Marshal
cards.text:
Dauntless River Marshal gets +1/+1 as long as you control an Island.
{3}{U}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: "Thieves and squid squirm the same way when you capture them."

cards.name: Devouring Light
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Exile target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: "Even your shadow is too foul to tolerate."

cards.name: Diffusion Sliver
cards.text: Whenever a Sliver creature you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter that spell or ability unless its controller pays {2}.
cards.flavor:
"The hive shimmered, and its walls seemed a living mirror."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

cards.name: Dissipate
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"This abomination never belonged in our world. I'm merely setting it free."
—Dierk, geistmage

cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle

cards.name: Divine Favor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Divine Favor enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
cards.flavor: With an armory of light, even the squire may champion her people.

cards.name: Divine Verdict
cards.text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: "Guilty."

cards.name: Elvish Mystic
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Life grows everywhere. My kin merely find those places where it grows strongest."
—Nissa Revane

cards.name: Encrust
cards.text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step and its activated abilities can't be activated.
cards.flavor:
"The sea blesses the tiny with the power to fell the mighty."
—Talrand, sky summoner

cards.name: Endless Obedience
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Ensoul Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact is a creature with base power and toughness 5/5 in addition to its other types.
cards.flavor: Too often, some self-described genius comes up with a "labor-saving device" that ends up creating far more work.

cards.name: Ephemeral Shields
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Target creature gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)

cards.name: Eternal Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink and "Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature." (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.

cards.name: Feast on the Fallen
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if an opponent lost life last turn, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"As our numbers dwindle, the ranks of the dead grow ever stronger."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

cards.name: Feral Incarnation
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Put three 3/3 green Beast creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Nature is itself wild—in all its forms.

cards.name: Festergloom
cards.text: Nonblack creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The death of a scout can be as informative as a safe return.

cards.name: First Response
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if you lost life last turn, put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"There's never a good time for a disaster or an attack. That's why we're here."
—Oren, militia captain

cards.name: Flesh to Dust
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Pain is temporary. So is life."
—Liliana Vess

cards.name: Forge Devil
cards.text: When Forge Devil enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: A bit of pain never hurts.

cards.name: Foundry Street Denizen
cards.text: Whenever another red creature enters the battlefield under your control, Foundry Street Denizen gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: After the Foundry Street riot, Arrester Hulbein tried to ban bludgeons. Which, inevitably, resulted in another riot.

cards.name: Frenzied Goblin
cards.text: Whenever Frenzied Goblin attacks, you may pay {R}. If you do, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: What he lacks in stature, he makes up for with enthusiasm.

cards.name: Frost Lynx
cards.text: When Frost Lynx enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: It readily attacks much larger prey, knowing retaliation is impossible.

cards.name: Fugitive Wizard
cards.flavor:
"The law has its place—as a footnote in my spellbook."
—Siyani, fugitive mage

cards.name: Furnace Whelp
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?

cards.name: Gargoyle Sentinel
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{3}: Until end of turn, Gargoyle Sentinel loses defender and gains flying.
cards.flavor: The beating of a gargoyle's wings on the air is like the cracking of stones. Intruders who rouse a gargoyle are certain to hear the cracking of bones.

cards.name: Garruk's Packleader
cards.text: Whenever another creature with power 3 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"He has learned much in his long years. And unlike selfish humans, he's willing to share."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

cards.name: Garruk, Apex Predator
cards.text:
+1: Destroy another target planeswalker.
+1: Put a 3/3 black Beast creature token with deathtouch onto the battlefield.
−3: Destroy target creature. You gain life equal to its toughness.
−8: Target opponent gets an emblem with "Whenever a creature attacks you, it gets +5/+5 and gains trample until end of turn."

cards.name: Gather Courage
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Geist of the Moors
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"The battle is won. There's work to be done. / The Blessed Sleep must wait. / A fiend is about. It stalks the devout. / I'll save them from my fate."
—"The Good Geist's Vow"

cards.name: Generator Servant
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Generator Servant: Add {2} to your mana pool. If that mana is spent on a creature spell, it gains haste until end of turn. (That creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Genesis Hydra
cards.text:
When you cast Genesis Hydra, reveal the top X cards of your library. You may put a nonland permanent card with converted mana cost X or less from among them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle the rest into your library.
Genesis Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: Designed by George Fan

cards.name: Glacial Crasher
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Glacial Crasher can't attack unless there is a Mountain on the battlefield.

cards.name: Goblin Kaboomist
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a colorless artifact token named Land Mine onto the battlefield with "{R}, Sacrifice this artifact: This artifact deals 2 damage to target attacking creature without flying." Then flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Goblin Kaboomist deals 2 damage to itself.
cards.flavor: Designed by Stone Librande

cards.name: Goblin Rabblemaster
cards.text:
Other Goblin creatures you control attack each turn if able.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token with haste onto the battlefield.
Whenever Goblin Rabblemaster attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Goblin.

cards.name: Goblin Roughrider
cards.flavor: Astride the bucking creature, Gribble hurtled down the mountainside while his Grotag brethren cheered. It was at that moment that the legend of the Skrill Tamer was born.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A grave is not always for burial.

cards.name: Grindclock
cards.text:
{T}: Put a charge counter on Grindclock.
{T}: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of charge counters on Grindclock.
cards.flavor: Pray you never hear it chime.

cards.name: Hammerhand
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Hammerhand enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has haste. (It can attack and {T} no matter when it came under your control.)

cards.name: Haunted Plate Mail
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +4/+4.
{0}: Until end of turn, Haunted Plate Mail becomes a 4/4 Spirit artifact creature that's no longer an Equipment. Activate this ability only if you control no creatures.
Equip {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Heat Ray
cards.text: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"There was clearly a scream. I'm not sure if there was a mouth."
—Sachir, Akoum Expeditionary House

cards.name: Heliod's Pilgrim
cards.text: When Heliod's Pilgrim enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Aura card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The blessings of Heliod are apparent for all to see.

cards.name: Hoarding Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Hoarding Dragon enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card, exile it, then shuffle your library.
When Hoarding Dragon dies, you may put the exiled card into its owner's hand.

cards.name: Hornet Nest
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Hornet Nest is dealt damage, put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens with flying and deathtouch onto the battlefield. (Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Hornet Queen
cards.text:
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Hornet Queen enters the battlefield, put four 1/1 green Insect creature tokens with flying and deathtouch onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Hot Soup
cards.text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked.
Whenever equipped creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor:
"Comin' through!"
Designed by James Ernest

cards.name: Hunt the Weak
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Then that creature fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor: He who hesitates is lunch.

cards.name: Hunter's Ambush
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by nongreen creatures this turn.
cards.flavor: First you lose your enemy's trail. Then you lose all sense of direction. Then you hear the growls . . .

cards.name: Hushwing Gryff
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
Creatures entering the battlefield don't cause abilities to trigger.
cards.flavor: An overwhelming sense of calm accompanies the gryffs that wheel above the roofs of Gavony.

cards.name: Hydrosurge
cards.text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Thirsty?"
—Drunvalus, hydromancer

cards.name: Illusory Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Cast Illusory Angel only if you've cast another spell this turn.
cards.flavor:
"In a daze, I woke and looked upon the battlefield, where I could swear my dreams were laying waste to the enemy."
—Letter from a soldier

cards.name: In Garruk's Wake
cards.text: Destroy all creatures you don't control and all planeswalkers you don't control.
cards.flavor: Beyond pain, beyond obsession and wild despair, there lies a place of twisted power only the most tormented souls can reach.

cards.name: Indulgent Tormentor
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card unless target opponent sacrifices a creature or pays 3 life.
cards.flavor: The promise of anguish is payment enough for services rendered.

cards.name: Inferno Fist
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
{R}, Sacrifice Inferno Fist: Inferno Fist deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: "I've never been above throwing the first punch."

cards.name: Inspired Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Impossible! How could they overwhelm us? We had barricades, war elephants, . . . and they were barely a tenth of our number!"
—General Avitora

cards.name: Into the Void
cards.text: Return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"The cathars have their swords, the inquisitors their axes. I prefer the ‘diplomatic' approach."
—Terhold, archmage of Drunau

cards.name: Invasive Species
cards.text: When Invasive Species enters the battlefield, return another permanent you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It's easier to relocate a village that lies in their path than to turn the bugs aside.

cards.name: Invisibility
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by Walls.
cards.flavor: Verick held his breath. Breathing wouldn't reveal his position, but it would force him to smell the goblins.

cards.name: Jace's Ingenuity
cards.text: Draw three cards.
cards.flavor: "Brute force can sometimes kick down a locked door, but knowledge is a skeleton key."

cards.name: Jace, the Living Guildpact
cards.text:
+1: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your graveyard.
−3: Return another target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
−8: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You draw seven cards.

cards.name: Jalira, Master Polymorphist
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonlegendary creature card. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
cards.flavor: "You can become anything if I just put my mind to it."

cards.name: Jorubai Murk Lurker
cards.text:
Jorubai Murk Lurker gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
{1}{B}: Target creature gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor: Many a besieged city has surrendered upon hearing the distinctive rumble of the juggernaut.

cards.name: Kalonian Twingrove
cards.text:
Kalonian Twingrove's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.
When Kalonian Twingrove enters the battlefield, put a green Treefolk Warrior creature token onto the battlefield with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control."

cards.name: Kapsho Kitefins
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Kapsho Kitefins or another creature enters the battlefield under your control, tap target creature an opponent controls.
cards.flavor:
"It's a truly disconcerting sight to see their shadows cast upon the deck."
—Captain Triff

cards.name: Kinsbaile Skirmisher
cards.text: When Kinsbaile Skirmisher enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "If a boggart even dares breathe near one of my kin, I'll know. And I'll not be happy."

cards.name: Kird Chieftain
cards.text:
Kird Chieftain gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Forest.
{4}{G}: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.name: Krenko's Enforcer
cards.text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
cards.flavor: He just likes to break legs. Collecting the debt is a bonus.

cards.name: Kurkesh, Onakke Ancient
cards.text: Whenever you activate an ability of an artifact, if it isn't a mana ability, you may pay {R}. If you do, copy that ability. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: The Onakke were masters of dark arts and artifice. Their creations continue to spread foul magic, paving the way for their return.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
cards.flavor: A strict upgrade over the cinder hatchet.

cards.name: Leeching Sliver
cards.text: Whenever a Sliver you control attacks, defending player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Seeing one slowly devour one of my party begged the question—do they know what cruelty is?"
—Hastric, Thunian scout

cards.name: Life's Legacy
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Life's Legacy, sacrifice a creature.
Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
cards.flavor: At the instant of death, the mystery of life.

cards.name: Lightning Strike
cards.text: Lightning Strike deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: To wield lightning is to tame chaos.

cards.name: Liliana Vess
cards.text:
+1: Target player discards a card.
−2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
−8: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Living Totem
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
When Living Totem enters the battlefield, you may put a +1/+1 counter on another target creature.

cards.name: Llanowar Wastes
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool. Llanowar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

cards.name: Marked by Honor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)
cards.flavor: Stand your post for duty. Stand your ground for honor.

cards.name: Mass Calcify
cards.text: Destroy all nonwhite creatures.
cards.flavor: The dead serve as their own tombstones.

cards.name: Master of Predicaments
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Master of Predicaments deals combat damage to a player, choose a card in your hand. That player guesses whether the card's converted mana cost is greater than 4. If the player guessed wrong, you may cast the card without paying its mana cost.
cards.flavor: Designed by David Sirlin

cards.name: Meditation Puzzle
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
You gain 8 life.
cards.flavor: Find your center, and you will find your way.

cards.name: Mercurial Pretender
cards.text: You may have Mercurial Pretender enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature you control except it gains "{2}{U}{U}: Return this creature to its owner's hand."
cards.flavor: The king went off to find himself. Imagine his terror when he succeeded.

cards.name: Meteorite
cards.text:
When Meteorite enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: "And if I'm lying," he began . . .

cards.name: Midnight Guard
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, untap Midnight Guard.
cards.flavor:
"When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk

cards.name: Might Makes Right
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control each creature on the battlefield with the greatest power, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: An oath of fealty sworn with a handshake.

cards.name: Military Intelligence
cards.text: Whenever you attack with two or more creatures, draw a card.
cards.flavor: To know the battlefield is to anticipate the enemy. To know the enemy is to anticipate victory.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"It saddens me to lose a source of inspiration. This one seemed especially promising."
—Ashiok

cards.name: Mind Sculpt
cards.text: Target opponent puts the top seven cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Your mind was a curious mix of madness and genius. I just took away the genius."
—Jace Beleren

cards.name: Miner's Bane
cards.text: {2}{R}: Miner's Bane gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
cards.flavor: There are certain stones even dwarves know to leave in the earth.

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"When your cities and trinkets crumble, only nature will remain."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

cards.name: Necrobite
cards.text: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. Regenerate it. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat. Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Necrogen Scudder
cards.text:
Flying
When Necrogen Scudder enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: Contrary to popular belief, it's kept aloft by necrogen gas, not the screaming agony of a thousand murdered souls.

cards.name: Necromancer's Assistant
cards.text: When Necromancer's Assistant enters the battlefield, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Zombies and necromancers agree: easy access to brains is preferred.

cards.name: Necromancer's Stockpile
cards.text: {1}{B}, Discard a creature card: Draw a card. If the discarded card was a Zombie card, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: The experiments decided to perform some research of their own.

cards.name: Negate
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.
cards.flavor: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.

cards.name: Netcaster Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Netcaster Spider blocks a creature with flying, Netcaster Spider gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It is an expert at culling individuals who stray too far from the herd.

cards.name: Nightfire Giant
cards.text:
Nightfire Giant gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Mountain.
{4}{R}: Nightfire Giant deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Nightfire turns the greatest weakness of the undead into formidable strength.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

cards.name: Nimbus of the Isles
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: The people of the Sevick Isles have a unique understanding of the term "ominous clouds."

cards.name: Nissa's Expedition
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Nissa, Worldwaker
cards.text:
+1: Target land you control becomes a 4/4 Elemental creature with trample. It's still a land.
+1: Untap up to four target Forests.
−7: Search your library for any number of basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Those lands become 4/4 Elemental creatures with trample. They're still lands.

cards.name: Ob Nixilis, Unshackled
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Whenever an opponent searches his or her library, that player sacrifices a creature and loses 10 life.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Ob Nixilis, Unshackled.
cards.flavor: Designed by Brad Muir

cards.name: Obelisk of Urd
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
As Obelisk of Urd enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures you control of the chosen type get +2/+2.

cards.name: Oppressive Rays
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {3}.
Activated abilities of enchanted creature cost {3} more to activate.

cards.name: Oreskos Swiftclaw
cards.flavor:
After the Battle of Pharagax Bridge, the Champion spent many months among the leonin of Oreskos. She found that they were quick to take offense, not because they were thin-skinned, but because they were always eager for a fight.
—The Theriad

cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Once a year, the skies over Paliano fill with the flying machines of those who hope to be taken on as pupils by the artificer Muzzio.

cards.name: Overwhelm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Conclave acts with a single will, expressed by countless warriors.

cards.name: Paragon of Eternal Wilds
cards.text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Another target green creature you control gains trample until end of turn. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.name: Paragon of Fierce Defiance
cards.text:
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
{R}, {T}: Another target red creature you control gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.name: Paragon of Gathering Mists
cards.text:
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
{U}, {T}: Another target blue creature you control gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Paragon of New Dawns
cards.text:
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
{W}, {T}: Another target white creature you control gains vigilance until end of turn. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)

cards.name: Paragon of Open Graves
cards.text:
Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Another target black creature you control gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Peel from Reality
cards.text: Return target creature you control and target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: "Soulless demon, you are bound to me. Now we will both dwell in oblivion."

cards.name: Perilous Vault
cards.text: {5}, {T}, Exile Perilous Vault: Exile all nonland permanents.
cards.flavor: The spirit dragon Ugin arranged the hedrons of Zendikar to direct leylines of energy. To disrupt one is to unleash devastation and chaos.

cards.name: Phyrexian Revoker
cards.text:
As Phyrexian Revoker enters the battlefield, name a nonland card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated.
cards.flavor:
"To be in the presence of a revoker is to be truly alone."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

cards.name: Phytotitan
cards.text: When Phytotitan dies, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control at the beginning of his or her next upkeep.
cards.flavor: Its root system spans the entire floor of the jungle, making eradication impossible.

cards.name: Pillar of Light
cards.text: Exile target creature with toughness 4 or greater.
cards.flavor:
"The vaulted ceiling of our faith rests upon such pillars."
—Darugand, banisher priest

cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid

cards.name: Polymorphist's Jest
cards.text: Until end of turn, each creature target player controls loses all abilities and becomes a blue Frog with base power and toughness 1/1.
cards.flavor:
"The flies were bothering me."
—Jalira, master polymorphist

cards.name: Preeminent Captain
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Preeminent Captain attacks, you may put a Soldier creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.

cards.name: Profane Memento
cards.text: Whenever a creature card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"An angel's skull is left too plain by death. I made a few aesthetic modifications."
—Dommique, blood artist

cards.name: Quickling
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Quickling enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return another creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Radiant Fountain
cards.text:
When Radiant Fountain enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"All peoples treasure a place where the weary traveler may drink in peace."
—Ajani Goldmane

cards.name: Raise the Alarm
cards.text: Put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Like blinking or breathing, responding to an alarm is an involuntary reflex.

cards.name: Ranger's Guile
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor:
"You don't survive in the wild by standing in plain sight."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

cards.name: Razorfoot Griffin
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.

cards.name: Reclamation Sage
cards.text: When Reclamation Sage enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: "What was once formed by masons, shaped by smiths, or given life by mages, I will return to the embrace of the earth."

cards.name: Research Assistant
cards.text: {3}{U}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: There are many words and phrases that can cause an experienced wizard to tremble in fear. Chief among them is "oops."

cards.name: Resolute Archangel
cards.text:
Flying
When Resolute Archangel enters the battlefield, if your life total is less than your starting life total, it becomes equal to your starting life total.
cards.flavor: Cut it down, bury it in snow, put it to the torch. The rose will still bloom again.

cards.name: Restock
cards.text: Return two target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Restock.
cards.flavor: What looked like a retreat was actually a replenishing.

cards.name: Return to the Ranks
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Return X target creature cards with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Roaring Primadox
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"They're easy enough to find. Question is, are you sure you want to find one?"
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

cards.name: Rogue's Gloves
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: Professional pilferers prefer proper preparation.

cards.name: Rotfeaster Maggot
cards.text: When Rotfeaster Maggot enters the battlefield, exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain life equal to that card's toughness.
cards.flavor: Is it at the top of the food chain or the bottom?

cards.name: Rummaging Goblin
cards.text: {T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: To a goblin, value is based on the four S's: shiny, stabby, smelly, and super smelly.

cards.name: Runeclaw Bear
cards.flavor: The magic of the elves leaves its mark on the forest. The magic of the forest leaves its mark on the animals who live there. The animals of the forest leave their mark on all who trespass.

cards.name: Sacred Armory
cards.text: {2}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Arrive for worship. Leave for war.

cards.name: Sanctified Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. White creatures you control also gain first strike until end of turn. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: You need only raise your spear to receive this blessing.

cards.name: Satyr Wayfinder
cards.text: When Satyr Wayfinder enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: The first satyr to wake after a revel must search for the site of the next one.

cards.name: Scrapyard Mongrel
cards.text: As long as you control an artifact, Scrapyard Mongrel gets +2/+0 and has trample. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
cards.flavor: Trespassers are welcome to try.

cards.name: Scuttling Doom Engine
cards.text:
Scuttling Doom Engine can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
When Scuttling Doom Engine dies, it deals 6 damage to target opponent.
cards.flavor: A masterwork of spite, inspired by madness.

cards.name: Seismic Strike
cards.text: Seismic Strike deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor:
"Life up here is simple. Adapt to the ways of the mountains and they will reward you. Fight them and they will end you."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer

cards.name: Selfless Cathar
cards.text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Selfless Cathar: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "If I fail to offer myself, we will surely be overrun. My fate would be the same."

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
cards.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

cards.name: Seraph of the Masses
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Flying
Seraph of the Masses's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor: Follow the light. In its absence, follow her.

cards.name: Shadowcloak Vampire
cards.text: Pay 2 life: Shadowcloak Vampire gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: "My favorite guilty pleasure? Are there innocent ones?"

cards.name: Shaman of Spring
cards.text: When Shaman of Spring enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Some shamanic sects advocate the different seasons, each working to preserve nature's cycles.

cards.name: Shield of the Avatar
cards.text:
If a source would deal damage to equipped creature, prevent X of that damage, where X is the number of creatures you control.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor:
We are made stronger by those we fight for.
Designed by Richard Garriott

cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

cards.name: Shivan Reef
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool. Shivan Reef deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Shrapnel Blast
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Shrapnel Blast, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: It requires immense pressure to imbue an item with magic. If the spell is broken . . .

cards.name: Siege Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Siege Dragon enters the battlefield, destroy all Walls your opponents control.
Whenever Siege Dragon attacks, if defending player controls no Walls, it deals 2 damage to each creature without flying that player controls.

cards.name: Siege Wurm
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.name: Sign in Blood
cards.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.
cards.flavor: Little agonies pave the way to greater power.

cards.name: Sliver Hive
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a Sliver spell.
{5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if you control a Sliver.

cards.name: Sliver Hivelord
cards.text: Sliver creatures you control have indestructible. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)
cards.flavor:
"This is the source, the line unbroken since the calamity that brought such monsters to our shores."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

cards.name: Solemn Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"You will be reimbursed for your donation."
"The reimbursement is spiritual."
—Temple signs

cards.name: Soul of Innistrad
cards.text:
Deathtouch
{3}{B}{B}: Return up to three target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
{3}{B}{B}, Exile Soul of Innistrad from your graveyard: Return up to three target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Soul of New Phyrexia
cards.text:
Trample
{5}: Permanents you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
{5}, Exile Soul of New Phyrexia from your graveyard: Permanents you control gain indestructible until end of turn.

cards.name: Soul of Ravnica
cards.text:
Flying
{5}{U}{U}: Draw a card for each color among permanents you control.
{5}{U}{U}, Exile Soul of Ravnica from your graveyard: Draw a card for each color among permanents you control.

cards.name: Soul of Shandalar
cards.text:
First strike
{3}{R}{R}: Soul of Shandalar deals 3 damage to target player and 3 damage to up to one target creature that player controls.
{3}{R}{R}, Exile Soul of Shandalar from your graveyard: Soul of Shandalar deals 3 damage to target player and 3 damage to up to one target creature that player controls.

cards.name: Soul of Theros
cards.text:
Vigilance
{4}{W}{W}: Creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain first strike and lifelink until end of turn.
{4}{W}{W}, Exile Soul of Theros from your graveyard: Creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain first strike and lifelink until end of turn.

cards.name: Soul of Zendikar
cards.text:
Reach
{3}{G}{G}: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
{3}{G}{G}, Exile Soul of Zendikar from your graveyard: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Soulmender
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "Healing is more art than magic. Well, there is still quite a bit of magic."

cards.name: Spectra Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has protection from all colors. This effect doesn't remove Auras. (It can't be blocked, targeted, or dealt damage by anything that's white, blue, black, red, or green.)

cards.name: Spirit Bonds
cards.text:
Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {W}. If you do, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
{1}{W}, Sacrifice a Spirit: Target non-Spirit creature gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Designed by Justin Gary

cards.name: Stab Wound
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Staff of the Death Magus
cards.text: Whenever you cast a black spell or a Swamp enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: A symbol of ambition in ruthless times.

cards.name: Staff of the Flame Magus
cards.text: Whenever you cast a red spell or a Mountain enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: A symbol of passion in indifferent times.

cards.name: Staff of the Mind Magus
cards.text: Whenever you cast a blue spell or an Island enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: A symbol of sagacity in bewildering times.

cards.name: Staff of the Sun Magus
cards.text: Whenever you cast a white spell or a Plains enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: A symbol of conviction in uncertain times.

cards.name: Staff of the Wild Magus
cards.text: Whenever you cast a green spell or a Forest enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: A symbol of ferocity in oppressive times.

cards.name: Stain the Mind
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Name a nonland card. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Statute of Denial
cards.text: Counter target spell. If you control a blue creature, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: "Pyrotechnic activity of any sort is strictly prohibited. It is irrelevant that today is a holiday."

cards.name: Stoke the Flames
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Stoke the Flames deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Stormtide Leviathan
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
All lands are Islands in addition to their other types.
Creatures without flying or islandwalk can't attack.

cards.name: Sunblade Elf
cards.text:
Sunblade Elf gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Plains.
{4}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "We patrol the steppes to keep enemies from the forest verge."

cards.name: Sungrace Pegasus
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: The sacred feathers of the pegasus are said to have healing powers.

cards.name: Terra Stomper
cards.text:
Terra Stomper can't be countered.
Trample
cards.flavor: Its footfalls cause violent earthquakes, hurtling boulders, and unseasonable dust storms.

cards.name: The Chain Veil
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, if you didn't activate a loyalty ability of a planeswalker this turn, you lose 2 life.
{4}, {T}: For each planeswalker you control, you may activate one of its loyalty abilities once this turn as though none of its loyalty abilities have been activated this turn.

cards.name: Thundering Giant
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: The giant was felt a few seconds before he was seen.

cards.name: Tireless Missionaries
cards.text: When Tireless Missionaries enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: If they succeed in their holy work, their order will vanish into welcome obscurity, for there will be no more souls to redeem.

cards.name: Titanic Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The massive dominate through might. The tiny survive with guile. Beware the tiny who become massive.

cards.name: Torch Fiend
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Devils redecorate every room with fire.

cards.name: Tormod's Crypt
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: Dominaria's most extravagant crypt nevertheless holds an empty grave.

cards.name: Triplicate Spirits
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Put three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield. (They can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Turn to Frog
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and becomes a blue Frog with base power and toughness 1/1.
cards.flavor: "Ribbit."

cards.name: Typhoid Rats
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.

cards.name: Tyrant's Machine
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Though tempered differently, all wills can be broken."
—Inquisitor Kyrik

cards.name: Ulcerate
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn. You lose 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"If it were merely lethal, that would be sufficient. The art, however, is in maximizing the suffering it causes."
—Liliana Vess

cards.name: Undergrowth Scavenger
cards.text: Undergrowth Scavenger enters the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: It sees a rotting carcass as a good wine which has been aged properly.

cards.name: Unmake the Graves
cards.text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "I'm raising an army. Any volunteers?"

cards.name: Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth
cards.text: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.
cards.flavor:
"Yawgmoth's corpse is a wound in the universe. His foul blood seeps out, infecting the land with his final curse."
—Lord Windgrace

cards.name: Venom Sliver
cards.text: Sliver creatures you control have deathtouch. (Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor:
"We attacked with arrows dipped in poison. The slivers that did not die began to change."
—Hastric, Thunian scout

cards.name: Verdant Haven
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Verdant Haven enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Vineweft
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{4}{G}: Return Vineweft from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Fortified by the wilds.

cards.name: Void Snare
cards.text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"I've tried so many variations on how to get rid of annoying things that it's hard to decide which one I like best."
—Ashurel, voidmage

cards.name: Walking Corpse
cards.flavor:
"Feeding a normal army is a problem of logistics. With zombies, it is an asset. Feeding is why they fight. Feeding is why they are feared."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

cards.name: Wall of Essence
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Essence is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor:
"If you cannot turn your enemy's strength to weakness, then make that strength your own."
—Gresha, warrior sage

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Mercy is for those who keep their distance.

cards.name: Wall of Frost
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen countless petty warmongers gaze on it for a time before turning away."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

cards.name: Wall of Limbs
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Wall of Limbs.
{5}{B}{B}, Sacrifice Wall of Limbs: Target player loses X life, where X is Wall of Limbs's power.

cards.name: Wall of Mulch
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}, Sacrifice a Wall: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Mulch is the fabric of life in the forest. Plants live in it, they die in it, and then they become part of it, feeding countless generations to come.

cards.name: Warden of the Beyond
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Warden of the Beyond gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent owns a card in exile.
cards.flavor:
He draws strength from a vast source few mortals can fathom.
Designed by Isaiah Cartwright

cards.name: Waste Not
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent discards a creature card, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
Whenever an opponent discards a land card, add {B}{B} to your mana pool.
Whenever an opponent discards a noncreature, nonland card, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Designed by the Magic community

cards.name: Welkin Tern
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Welkin Tern can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Sailors have come to regard them as bad luck, for they falsely bring hope of land.

cards.name: Will-Forged Golem
cards.text: Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
cards.flavor: The modular nature of the automaton's design makes assembly perfectly intuitive.

cards.name: Witch's Familiar
cards.flavor: Some bog witches practice the strange art of batrachomancy, reading portents in the number, size, and color of warts on a toad's hide.

cards.name: Xathrid Slyblade
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{3}{B}: Until end of turn, Xathrid Slyblade loses hexproof and gains first strike and deathtouch. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Designed by Rob Pardo

cards.name: Yavimaya Coast
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool. Yavimaya Coast deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Yisan, the Wanderer Bard
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}, Put a verse counter on Yisan, the Wanderer Bard: Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost equal to the number of verse counters on Yisan, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Designed by Brian Fargo

cards.name: Zof Shade
cards.text: {2}{B}: Zof Shade gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Shades are drawn to places of power, often rooting themselves in a single area to feed.
